intro: Chrysanthemum italicum, commonly known as the Italian chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters, featuring finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow, white, and orange, which bloom from late summer to early autumn. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements. Its botanical characteristics make it both ornamental and useful in traditional herbal medicine.
